index.title: Semantic caracterisation of sound timbre
index.introduction1: Sound timbre is the feature that allow to make a distinction between two sounds of same loudness and same pitch. Sound timbre has multiple dimensions often used to describe sounds.
index.introduction2: Speaking about timbre is an activity that share numerous professionals, from the conductor to the sound designer. They mus adapt their vocabulary depending on who their talking to and what kind of knowledge they got. Hence in the case of a creative process (rehearsal, sound design project, mixing session...), things can get blurry sometimes
index.introduction3: Unfortunately, some words from the usual lexicon aren't always explicits, in spite of a frequent use. This survey aims to study the meaning of certain terms, and to unravel the related acoustic features.
